intro: Strobilanthes deflexa, commonly known as the bent-leaved makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves that curve downward. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
